For a real number $x,$ let
\[f(x) = \max \{|x + 15|, |x + 12|, |x + 8|, |x - 1|, |x - 3|, |x - 19|\}.\]Find the minimum value of $f(x).$

Let $f(x) = \max \{|x + 15|, |x + 12|, |x + 8|, |x - 1|, |x - 3|, |x - 19|\}$.
We want to find the minimum value of $f(x)$. The points where the absolute values change sign are $x=-15, -12, -8, 1, 3, 19$. The values $x = -15, -12, -8, 1, 3, 19$ divide the real line into 7 intervals: $(-\infty, -15)$, $[-15, -12]$, $[-12, -8]$, $[-8, 1]$, $[1, 3]$, $[3, 19]$, $(19, \infty)$.
On the interval $(-\infty, -15)$, we have $f(x) = -(x+15) - (x+12) - (x+8) - (x-1) - (x-3) - (x-19) = -6x - 12$.
On the interval $[-15, -12]$, we have $f(x) = x+15 - (x+12) - (x+8) - (x-1) - (x-3) - (x-19) = -3x + 18$.
On the interval $[-12, -8]$, we have $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 - (x+8) - (x-1) - (x-3) - (x-19) = x+30 - 3x + 23 = -2x + 53$.
On the interval $[-8, 1]$, we have $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 - (x-1) - (x-3) - (x-19) = 3x + 48 - (2x - 22) = x + 70$.
On the interval $[1, 3]$, we have $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 + x-1 + x-3 - (x-19) = 4x + 41 - (x-19) = 3x+60$.
On the interval $[3, 19]$, we have $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 + x-1 + x-3 + x-19 = 5x + 12$.
On the interval $(19, \infty)$, we have $f(x) = x+15+x+12+x+8+x-1+x-3+x-19 = 5x-2$.
We consider the critical points.
At $x=-15$, $f(-15) = |0| + |3| + |7| + |16| + |18| + |34| = 3+7+16+18+34 = 88$.
At $x=-12$, $f(-12) = |3| + |0| + |4| + |13| + |15| + |31| = 3+4+13+15+31 = 66$.
At $x=-8$, $f(-8) = |7| + |4| + |0| + |9| + |11| + |27| = 7+4+9+11+27 = 58$.
At $x=1$, $f(1) = |16| + |13| + |9| + |0| + |-2| + |-18| = 16+13+9+0+2+18=58$.
At $x=3$, $f(3) = |18| + |15| + |11| + |2| + |0| + |-16| = 18+15+11+2+0+16 = 62$.
At $x=19$, $f(19) = |34| + |31| + |27| + |18| + |16| + |0| = 34+31+27+18+16+0 = 136$.
Thus, the minimum value of $f(x)$ is 58.

Final Answer: $\boxed{58}$

Let $f(x) = \max \{|x + 15|, |x + 12|, |x + 8|, |x - 1|, |x - 3|, |x - 19|\}$.
The critical points are $x=-15, -12, -8, 1, 3, 19$.
We consider the values of $f(x)$ at these points:
$f(-15) = \max\{0, 3, 7, 16, 18, 34\} = 34$
$f(-12) = \max\{3, 0, 4, 13, 15, 31\} = 31$
$f(-8) = \max\{7, 4, 0, 9, 11, 27\} = 27$
$f(1) = \max\{16, 13, 9, 0, 2, 18\} = 18$
$f(3) = \max\{18, 15, 11, 2, 0, 16\} = 18$
$f(19) = \max\{34, 31, 27, 18, 16, 0\} = 34$

The minimum value of $f(x)$ is the minimum value of $f(x)$ on the intervals determined by the critical points.
We look for the minimum value of $f(x)$ on each interval:
On $[-8, 1]$, $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 + (-(x-1)) + (-(x-3)) + (-(x-19)) = x+70$
On $[1, 3]$, $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 + (x-1) + (x-3) + (x-19) = 3x+60$
On $[3, 19]$, $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 + x-1 + x-3 + x-19 = 5x+12$
On $(19, \infty)$, $f(x) = x+15 + x+12 + x+8 + x-1 + x-3 + x-19 = 5x-2$

On $[-8, 1]$, $f(x) = x+70 \Rightarrow f(-8)=58$
On $[1, 3]$, $f(x) = 3x+60 \Rightarrow f(1)=63$
On $[3, 19]$, $f(x) = 5x+12 \Rightarrow f(3)=62$

At $x=-8$, $f(-8)=58$ is the minimum value.

Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{58}$
